docs.snippet: A Kansas county elections official used close ties to one of the nation's leading advocates of voting restrictions to help secure the top job at a government agency entrusted with making voting more accessible, and then used the federal position t...
docs.lead_paragraph: A Kansas county elections official used close ties to one of the nation's leading advocates of voting restrictions to help secure the top job at a government agency entrusted with making voting more accessible, and then used the federal position to implement an obstacle to voter registration in three states.

headline.main: US Elections Head Used Political Ties, Then Curbed Voting
headline.print_headline: US Elections Head Used Political Ties, Then Curbed Voting

docs.snippet: The fact is, we do. And in some cases, it can be ethically justified....
docs.abstract: The fact is, we do. And in some cases, it can be ethically justified.

headline.main: Is Voting Out of Self-Interest Wrong?

docs.snippet: Next Tuesday's Wisconsin presidential primary is emerging as a crucial lifeline for Republicans desperate to stop Donald Trump's march to their party's nomination. One of his worst weeks of the 2016 campaign is colliding with a state already skept...
docs.lead_paragraph: Next Tuesday's Wisconsin presidential primary is emerging as a crucial lifeline for Republicans desperate to stop Donald Trump's march to their party's nomination. One of his worst weeks of the 2016 campaign is colliding with a state already skeptical of his brash brand of politics.

headline.main: Trump Stumbling in Wisconsin as Forces Coalesce Against Him
headline.print_headline: Trump Stumbling in Wisconsin as Forces Coalesce Against Him

docs.snippet: South Africa's top court ordered President Jacob Zuma on Thursday to pay back some of the $16 million of state money spent upgrading his private home, in a stinging rebuke that hits the scandal-plagued leader financially and politically....
docs.lead_paragraph: South Africa's top court ordered President Jacob Zuma on Thursday to pay back some of the $16 million of state money spent upgrading his private home, in a stinging rebuke that hits the scandal-plagued leader financially and politically.

headline.main: South Africa's Top Court Orders Zuma to Reimburse State
headline.print_headline: South Africa's Top Court Orders Zuma to Reimburse State

docs.snippet: As President Obama and President Xi Jinping of China prepare to meet, Beijing is viewing the vitriol from candidates like Donald J. Trump as a gauge of American intentions....
docs.lead_paragraph: As President Obama and President Xi Jinping of China prepare to meet, Beijing is viewing the vitriol from candidates like Donald J. Trump as a gauge of American intentions.
docs.abstract: Numerous attacks and criticisms levied against China by American presidential candidates from both parties is likely to overshadow upcoming meeting between Pres Obama and Chinese Pres Xi Jinping.

headline.main: Campaign Season’s Anti-China Tone Is Likely to Cloud Meeting With Obama
headline.print_headline: Campaign Season’s Anti-China Tone Is Likely to Cloud Meeting With Obama
